image.altText: Pankti Bhavsar

props.synopsis: The new BAPS Mandir in Taylor is an important meeting place for Canberra's growing Hindu population — and it was the personal sacrifices from those within the community that have made this dream a reality.

title.children: This new temple in Canberra is more than a building — for some it's a 'purely living entity'

image.altText: Cannabis Hackett 5

props.synopsis: Police arrest a man and seize 164 cannabis plants from an alleged grow house in suburban Canberra.

title.children: Police arrest Canberra man and seize 164 cannabis plants from Hackett grow house

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old man is freed on bail, accused of sexually assaulting a 13-year-old girl in 2011.

title.children: Canberra man granted bail after facing court over alleged sexual assault of 13-year-old girl

image.altText: A Woolworths branded trolley connected to a Coles branded trolley.

props.synopsis: 'Colesworth', a portmanteau referring to the perceived duopoly of supermarket retailers Coles and Woolworths, is the Australian National Dictionary Centre's Word of the Year for 2024.

title.children: Word of the Year reflects increasing frustration with Australia's top supermarkets

image.altText: A woman shears a sheep as two men watch.

props.synopsis: The 37-year-old mother-of-four managed a running average of 72.3 seconds per lamb to secure a place in the shearing record books.

title.children: Yass woman shears 395 merino lambs in eight hours, setting world record

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A jury is considering its verdict in Senior Constable Kristian White's manslaughter trial. The police officer tasered great-grandmother Clare Nowland, who later died in hospital.

title.children: Jury retires to consider fate of NSW police officer who tasered a 95yo woman

image.altText: A man looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride has given an interview to the ABC from the Canberra prison where he is serving a sentence of more than five years for leaking secret military documents to journalists.

title.children: 'It's a dangerous place': Whistleblower David McBride tells of his life in Canberra prison

props.synopsis: The National Archives of Australia has digitised over a million service records from World War II, many of which haven't been seen for 80 years.

title.children: Merle was one of many who served in WWII. Aged 104, she's seeing her records for the first time

image.altText: Three women wearing green, blue and red saris sew at sewing machines in a line.

props.synopsis: The fast fashion giant behind Millers, Rivers and Katies has left factories in Bangladesh scrambling for reportedly more than $30 million in unpaid invoices — and the fallout threatens the livelihoods of thousands of women.

title.children: 'We only want what we've earned': The human toll of Australian fast fashion giant's collapse

image.altText: Various people seen in a crowded suburb of Sydney

props.synopsis: From Friday morning, trains across and into Sydney will come to a halt. The NSW government has said there will be some new measures to help address demand, but what exactly will they be?

title.children: What we do and don't know about public transport services during the Sydney rail shutdown

image.altText: Shorten holds an index finger up as he talks.

props.synopsis: Former Labor leader Bill Shorten will reflect on his life in politics as he gives his final speech later today. Follow live.

title.children: Bill Shorten to give final speech as he bows out from politics

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Shorten's daughter not 'thrilled' by social media ban but says something had to be done
Labor defends major change to Future Fund

image.altText: Close up photo of young woman with red hair, eyebrow and nose piercings

props.synopsis: The family of 19-year-old Isla Bell say they are trying to process the "unimaginable" after her remains were believed to have been found at a Melbourne tip.

title.children: 'Her hopes and dreams have been taken away': Isla Bell's family grieves after men charged over her death

image.altText: mid shot of man wearing glasses and suit with plane in background

props.synopsis: Albanese's consistency on trade and calls to stick with the Paris climate agreement suggest he's not scared of taking a different policy path to Donald Trump. That doesn't mean navigating the path ahead will be easy.

title.children: The awkward moment that sums up world politics at the moment

image.altText: Snapchat icon on a smartphone screen.

props.synopsis: The government will introduce its bill to parliament to ban under 16s from social media sites including X and TikTok, with hefty fines for flouting rules.

title.children: Snapchat will not escape the government's proposed social media ban for under 16s

image.altText: A silhouette of a pregnant woman outside.

props.synopsis: A new report shows only 6 per cent of child protection funding goes to Aboriginal-run organisations, despite these groups often posting better outcomes.

title.children: First Nations children are being removed from families at highest levels ever recorded

image.altText: Hip hop group 3% on stage at the 2024 ARIA awards accepting an award

props.synopsis: First Nations artists win big at an ARIA Awards ceremony that celebrates the breadth of Australian music.

title.children: 'We're taking them all home': First Nations artists shine at 2024 ARIA Awards

image.altText: A sheikh delivering a televised address in front of a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: Israel and Hezbollah appear unwilling to compromise on how a proposed ceasefire deal between the two sides would be enforced, with the Israeli government saying it wants "the freedom to act" within Lebanon.

title.children: Hezbollah vows retaliation in Tel Aviv as sticking point holds up truce negotiations

image.altText: A man observes a cruise missile on display

props.synopsis: The reports in British media come after US-supplied long-range missiles were reportedly used for the first time on Russian soil.

title.children: Ukraine fires UK-supplied Storm Shadow missiles at targets inside Russia for first time

image.altText: Alan Jones leaves Day Street police station on bail with lawyer Bryan Wrench, Christopher Murphy

props.synopsis: The 83-year-old former radio presenter was charged with multiple counts of indecent assault and sexual touching offences this week.

title.children: What could happen in court after veteran broadcaster Alan Jones submits his plea

image.altText: A black and white photo of Liam Payne is stuck to a pole with the words 'rest in peace' written on it

props.synopsis: The family and friends of the late One Direction star came together at a small service outside of London to farewell Liam Payne, who died last month.

title.children: One Direction bandmates, family and friends pay their respects to Liam Payne at private funeral in England

image.altText: A female student completes her exam using a laptop.

props.synopsis: Despite going through three levels of a checking process, yet another Tasmanian exam paper has been found to contain an error — the sixth mistake discovered across exam papers in two weeks.

title.children: Student calls for accountability after all of her end-of-year exams had errors in them

image.altText: A composite image of a ballerina and her parents shielding themselves with jackets

props.synopsis: The parents of a malnourished Perth teenager doctors warned would die without medical help have been found guilty of starving her.

title.children: Parents guilty of starving their emaciated teenage daughter who they treated like a 'little girl'

image.altText: Woman with dark curly shoulder length hair and light brown skin sits in front of a laptop in an office late at night

props.synopsis: The latest report predicts rapid growth in the clean energy workforce, science industry and healthcare and disability sector.

title.children: Some of the jobs of the future are only just emerging, and they don't all need a uni degree

image.altText: A close up of Sararat Rangsiwuthaporn's standing in front of a sign indicating her height.

props.synopsis: A woman dubbed "Am Cyanide" by Thai media has faced her first of 14 murder trials involving alleged cyanide poisonings.

title.children: Thailand's worst suspected serial killer sentenced to death over cyanide killing

image.altText: A screenshot from an ad showing an Indian couple taking a selfie near the MCG.

props.synopsis: Tourism Australia's mascot Ruby the Roo has a new batting partner in Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins, who stars alongside her in a multi-million-dollar campaign aimed at enticing more Indian travellers Down Under.

title.children: With visitors from China in decline, Australia's tourism industry is now trying to entice India

image.altText: Illustrated colour image of woman with long flowing red hair against dark background. Her expression is strong and serious.

props.synopsis: Di McDonald was stalked for three years and spent five years seeking justice. Eventually her stalker was jailed, and now she's trying to make it easier for others like her to get help.

title.children: Stalking statistics lead to calls for better support for victims, but also for perpetrators

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian share market to slip, Nvidia guidance fails to impress investors and Gautam Adani charged in US. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to fall as Wall Street slips, Gautam Adani charged in US

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Government tells Future Fund to invest in climate and housing
Nvidia forecast beats estimates but fails to impress investors
Gautam Adani charged in US over bribery

image.altText: AFL draftee Sam Lalor stands on stage holding a Richmond guernsey next to former Tigers captain Trent Cotchin.

props.synopsis: Shortly after becoming the number one pick in the 2024 AFL Draft, Sam Lalor did not shy away when asked whether he would like to take the number Dustin Martin made his own at Richmond.

title.children: 'I'd definitely like it': Richmond's top draft pick Sam Lalor hunting Dustin Martin's iconic number in debut season

image.altText: A plastic bag containing potatoes

props.synopsis: An audit shows supermarket customers are charged less for plastic-wrapped produce more than 70 per cent of the time, and conservationists say it's hurting the environment.

title.children: Supermarkets making plastic problem worse with cheap pre-packaged produce, report finds

image.altText: A woman sitting on a couch, holding her stomach and facing away from the camera.

props.synopsis: While many people may think they have "excessive flatulence", research suggests lots of farts are a sign of a healthy gut.

title.children: 'Accept the farts': Why scientists say extra gas might not be a bad thing

image.altText: A man lying in a hospital bed with wires on his body, smiling with thumbs up

props.synopsis: Kacper Krupa is fortunate to be alive after he was stung by a stonefish at Hearson's Cove, a popular swimming beach near Karratha.

title.children: Man endures deadly stonefish sting 'like an elephant was kicking your heart'

image.altText: Indian cricketer Virat Kohli trains with teammates at Perth Stadium.

props.synopsis: Can Australia win the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the first time in almost a decade? Or will India fire up after their loss to New Zealand to ensure all guns are blazing? Perth is ready to host the first Test in what shapes as a thrilling summer of cricket.

title.children: Australia, India gear up for Test series as prospect of rain raises questions over Perth pitch

image.altText: A road with palm trees along the side, and blue sky.

props.synopsis: Pacific aid dropped sharply as COVID support ended, while China has re-emerged as the second largest donor in the region.

title.children: China becomes second largest provider of aid to the Pacific, new analysis shows

image.altText: A wide shot of a bedroom that's completely painted royal blue. Lantern lights hang from the ceiling above the bed

props.synopsis: Celeste and Anna knew their plan to design a house without a single white surface, filled with bold splashes of colour, was daring. What they didn't expect was the impact the blue, yellow and red rooms would have on their moods.

title.children: Couple embrace challenge of a rainbow house with no white surfaces
